title: (x) square minimal pixel font similar to Unibody - Hooge 05\_56 {Simon Duckworth, Yves}
content:
I love this font. It’s very utilitarian — type at it most basic, yet with a bit of personality. Reminds me of [Unibody by Underware](http://web.archive.org/web/20061116104131/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=unibody&id2=overview) but that’s not what it is. Little help? Anyone?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [RubiconNav.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20061116104131/http:/typophile.com/files/RubiconNav.gif) | 740 bytes |
author: DesignGuyMemphis

comments.content:
Not the exactly the same, but similar – Lipo-D:

[http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/lipod.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20061116104131/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/lipod.asp)

I believe this is FFF Compact Extended released by Fonts for Flash.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/fff_3821.png)
Nice one, Yves. To be honest, looking at that list of titchy fonts has sent my eyes funny… ;)
Dude, tell me about it. Too many pixels! My eyes started twitching. :^P

Thank you all. Thanks especially for introducing me to these font sources. I’m so enamored with the Miniml Fonts (a little twitchy-eyed, but enamored nonetheless) that I think I’ll buy the whole package. You guys are the best.

DGM
